summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing scheduling a hearing on Jeffrey Epstein's motion to quash. The communication is marked as urgent and involves coordination with Judge Marra's courtroom deputy.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: Judge Marra's courtroom deputy (CRD) contacted the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office to schedule a hearing on Epstein's motion to quash.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of a motion to quash, indicating ongoing legal proceedings against him.

connections.description: Judge Marra is presiding over a hearing related to Epstein's motion to quash.

events.title: Scheduled Hearing on Epstein's Motion to Quash
events.description: Judge Marra's courtroom deputy contacted the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule a hearing for the next day on Jeffrey Epstein's motion to quash.

keyFacts: On September 11, 2007, Assistant U.S. Attorneys urgently discussed scheduling a hearing on Jeffrey Epstein's motion to quash.
Judge Marra's courtroom deputy contacted the prosecution to see if the hearing could be held the following morning (September 12, 2007).
The email chain indicates active legal proceedings against Epstein in federal court at that time.
The communication is marked as 'Urgent' and 'High' importance, suggesting the matter was time-sensitive.
The document shows coordination between the judge's chambers and the U.S. Attorney's office regarding Epstein's case.
